;============================ SPDUST.2 ===============================
;
;    Rotational emission from a population of spinning dust grains,
;    as described by Ali-Haimoud, Hirata & Dickinson, 2009, MNRAS, 395, 1055
;    and in Silsbee, Ali-Haimoud & Hirata, 2010
;    for an environment with parameters given below. 
;
;    nH = 30.000000 cm^-3
;    T = 100.00000 K
;    Chi = 1.0000000
;    xh = 0.0010000000
;    xC = 0.00030000000
;    mu(1E-7 cm) = 9.3000000 debye (this corresponds to beta = 0.38450768 debye)
;
;
    Diklike grains are asssumed to be randomly oriented with respect to their angular momentum vector.
;
;=====================================================================
;
;nu(GHz)       j_nu/nH(Jy sr-1 cm2/H)     
;
      0.50870968   1.0342112e-23
      0.52658684   1.1397979e-23
